dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: People think Fintiv is just some obscure mobile payments startup, but actually it's the rebranded version of Mozido, a company at the center of a massive alleged fraud.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: People think Fintiv is just some obscure mobile payments startup, but actually it's the rebranded version of Mozido, a company at the center of a massive alleged fraud.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But Fintiv used to be known by a different name, Mozido, a once-hot mobile payments startup at the center of a large alleged investment fraud and criminal prosecution. According to an amended certificate of incorporation filed with Delawares secretary of state, Mozido has changed its name to Fintiv.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and that name change happened right after the SEC charged Michael Liberty, their founder, with defrauding 190 individual investors out of, what was it, $52 million?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and that name change happened right after the S E C charged Michael Liberty, their founder, with defrauding one hundred ninety individual investors out of, what was it, fifty two dollars million?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Charlie Wiggs, president of Fintiv, signed the Delaware filing changing Mozidos name to Fintiv a few days after the Securities & Exchange Commission charged Liberty last year of defrauding 200 individual investors. The SEC claimed Liberty raised $55 million from individuals who thought they were investing in Mozido and diverted a large portion of those funds for his personal use.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, $52 million. And prosecutors claim he used some of that money for personal stuff, like interior decorating and payments to his ex-wife.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, fifty two dollars million. And prosecutors claim he used some of that money for personal stuff, like interior decorating and payments to his ex-wife.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition, Liberty raised some $55 million from individual investors for Mozido, most of which was transferred using shell companies to fund other Liberty companies, payments to his ex-wife and interior decorating, federal prosecutors claim.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just wild. And yet Mozido itself wasn't charged with any wrongdoing—only Liberty was indicted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just wild. And yet Mozido itself wasn't charged with any wrongdoing-only Liberty was indicted.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mozido itself was not charged. Again, Mozido itself was not accused of any wrongdoing by the SEC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. But now, under the name Fintiv, they're actively enforcing this broad patent portfolio they built up, including suing Apple.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. But now, under the name Fintiv, they're actively enforcing this broad patent portfolio they built up, including suing Apple.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Adolfo Salume, Fintivs chairman, confirmed to Forbes that Mozido is now doing business as Fintiv and that the company is actively working to enforce its broad patent portfolio. In February, two months after Fintiv sued Apple, federal prosecutors in Maine indicted Michael Liberty, accusing the founder of Mozido of orchestrating an investment fraud in connection with his fundraising activity around Mozido, the company he once claimed would revolutionize global payments.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, and it's interesting that some of those patents came from acquisitions, like that South Korean entity they bought back in 2014.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, and it's interesting that some of those patents came from acquisitions, like that South Korean entity they bought back in twenty fourteen.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The patent Fintiv is using to sue Apple lists inventors in South Korea, and Mozido acquired the patent when it purchased the South Korean entity that owned it in 2014.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Liberty once bragged they had 105 patents. Now Fintiv's chairman, Adolfo Salume, says they've formed a whole division just to enforce them through licensing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Liberty once bragged they had one hundred five patents. Now Fintiv's chairman, Adolfo Salume, says they've formed a whole division just to enforce them through licensing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Liberty showed a keen interest in patents and once bragged that Mozido had collected 100 of them.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But it's hard to ignore the connections though—like, Mike Love, who worked closely with Liberty at Mozido, is now a director at Fintiv. Even Liberty's cousin is on the board.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it's hard to ignore the connections though-like, Mike Love, who worked closely with Liberty at Mozido, is now a director at Fintiv. Even Liberty's cousin is on the board.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mike Love, who played a big management role at Mozido for years and worked closely with Liberty, is a director of Fintiv. So is Michael Libertys cousin, Stan Liberty.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And they're using the same law firm that represented Mozido for years. It really does feel like a rebrand with the same players.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're using the same law firm that represented Mozido for years. It really does feel like a rebrand with the same players.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In its lawsuit against Apple, Fintiv is represented by the law firm headed by Marc Kasowitz, who for years represented Mozido.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Though Salume did say Fintiv's policy is not to comment on the actions against Liberty. They're just focused on defending their intellectual property now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Though Salume did say Fintiv's policy is not to comment on the actions against Liberty. They're just focused on defending their intellectual property now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He said Fintivs policy is to not comment on the criminal and regulatory actions against Michael Liberty. We have decided to pursue our interest in terms of defending our intellectual property.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he claims lawsuits are a last resort—they prefer private negotiations. But still, given the history, it's a little hard to take at face value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he claims lawsuits are a last resort-they prefer private negotiations. But still, given the history, it's a little hard to take at face value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Our first inclination is to have a private negotiation like we did with Apple, and a lawsuit is only a product of the refusal to have a private negotiation, Salume said. There are other companies using our technology without a license so part of the task of our board is to protect the value of the investors in the company and we do have a strategy, not for lawsuits but for licenses a last resort is a lawsuit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. And don't forget, Mozido was once valued at almost $6 billion after raising hundreds of millions from big investors like Wellington Management.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. And don't forget, Mozido was once valued at almost six dollars billion after raising hundreds of millions from big investors like Wellington Management.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mozido raised $300 million from big investors to build a mobile payments company and was valued at about $5.6 billion when it purchased PayEase, a Chinese payment processor that generated the vast majority of Mozidos revenue.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then it all fell apart. They even sold their main revenue-generating unit, PayEase, just to pay off debt.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then it all fell apart. They even sold their main revenue-generating unit, PayEase, just to pay off debt.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mozido sold its most meaningful unit, PayEase, last year to pay back a large debt obligation that was partly used to repay employees for unpaid work.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's a classic rise and fall story, but with a new name and a patent lawsuit strategy instead.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a classic rise and fall story, but with a new name and a patent lawsuit strategy instead.
